news.title: LAMBORGHINI PRESENTS: THE ENGINE SONGS
news.content: Automobili Lamborghini lands on Spotify with a specially curated playlist dedicated to automotive enthusiasts. Existing tracks have been specifically selected to harmonize with the legendary roars of the V8, V10, and V12 engines. Immerse yourself in the Lamborghini experience on Spotify and have a look at the video below to see how this soon-to-be-iconic playlist was created.

news.title: LAMBORGHINI SUPER TROFEO ASIA TO RESTART IN 2023 WITH SIX DOUBLE APPOINTMENTS
news.content: The Lamborghini Super Trofeo Asia will restart in 2023 with a calendar of six double appointments. After a three-year stop due to the pandemic, the ninth edition of the single-brand championship is finally getting ready to be contended, alongside another two continental series to be competed in Europe and North America. The races will be held on two continents and in five different countries.The series will start off with the Sepang circuit on the first weekend of May, to then make landfall for the first time in Australia June 9-11, on the over seven kilometers of The Bend Motorsport Park near Adelaide.It will move on to Fuji, Japan in mid- July, while in August the championship will arrive in Inje, South Korea before its Chinese transfer to Shanghai scheduled for September.The last stage is then planned for the same weekend as the Lamborghini finals, the location and date of which will soon be made official. Up until today, 254 drivers of 30 different nationalities have raced in Lamborghini Super Trofeo Asia, with an average of participants constantly on the rise.The last ones to write their names on the prize record, in 2019, were Evan Chen and Chris van der Drift(Pro), Toshiyuki Ochiai and Afiq Yazid(Pro - Am), Huilin Han(Am) and Clement Li(Lamborghini Cup), awarded at the final appointment in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain.

news.title: CULTI MILANO FOR AUTOMOBILI LAMBORGHINI: THE SECOND SPECIAL EDITION IS BORN
news.content: Automobili Lamborghini and CULTI MILANO joined forces to give birth to the new special edition created by the artist Francesco Poroli, who has interpreted the collaboration between the two Italian brands and the fragrance made exclusively for Lamborghini with his unmistakable style. Poroli’s work decorates the 1000 ml Decor fragrance dispenser and its case with a series of sharp and snappy lines inspired by the design of the super sports cars.What explodes from the circle on the front of the dispenser is a world at the same time made of straight lines representing Lamborghini’s speed and energy, and gradations that conjure up the diffusion of the fragrance of CULTI MILANO.The perfect synthesis of two Italian excellences contained in a gem of art and design. On this subject, the artist said, “I developed this project observing a reverent and scrupulous attention to detail.Like in a Lamborghini super sports car where every single screw, element and detail seems to have a sense and a meaning.They perfectly combine with engineering talent to bring a dream to life.An identical approach is taken also for the CULTI MILANO world, whose prestige revolves around having introduced into man’s lifestyle the living culture, in which places aesthetically wear fragrance.”

news.title: THE ART OF MOTORSPORT PHOTOGRAPHY: LAMBORGHINI BY DARREN HEATH
news.content: The Lamborghini Huracán Super Trofeo EVO2 has never looked as amazing as in Darren Heath's shots. Colour, speed, power, sound and excitement: this renowned motorsport photographer has captured the unique features of the Lamborghini Super Trofeo’s unrivalled star. The Huracán Super Trofeo EVO2 has the characteristic ‘omega’ lip, a completely overhauled chassis and a unique sound created by a carbon duct and custom-made exhaust system. All this makes it the perfect subject for a photographer with a unique vision like Heath, whose work includes some of the most striking portraits of F1 drivers. “My special style is strongly influenced by an understanding of composition, using light to accentuate the subject, the photographer explains. I look for a clean, simple image, often using a shallow depth of field technique, and I have an 'old school' approach to making the image work as much as possible on-camera without having to rely on post-production software”. Heath followed a lap of the Lamborghini Super Trofeo at the Paul Ricard Le Castellet racetrack in the South of France. And who better to capture the more abstract elements of the Huracán Super Trofeo EVO2 at full throttle?

news.title: LAMBORGHINI BULL RUNS MEETS MOVEMBER AGAIN
news.content: Automobili Lamborghini*s Bull Runs are the perfect occasion to reach all Lamborghini Super Sports Cars* owners all over the world. This year we partnered up once more with Movember to raise funds and awareness about mental health, suicide prevention, prostate cancer and testicular cancer.

news.title: LAMBORGHINI RENEWS PARTNERSHIP WITH BOLOGNA AIRPORT
news.content: Automobili Lamborghini and Bologna Guglielmo Marconi Airport have extended their partnership until 2025. The collaboration began in 2013, and the renewal comes with many new, exclusive features.The Lamborghini exhibition space on the ground floor of the airport terminal has undergone complete restyling and now features a permanent display of a Lamborghini vehicle, among other things. Furthermore, the Follow Me Car accompanying planes to and from the runway is now a Huracán EVO with a brand-new yellow-and-black livery. Finally, travelers who pre-book Marconi Airport’s VIP service can enjoy exclusive transportation in the form of a Lamborghini Urus that will escort them from the runway to the terminal and vice versa. “This special collaboration continues between our company and Bologna Airport,” remarked Stephan Winkelmann, Chairman and CEO of Automobili Lamborghini. “The presence of Lamborghini in this hub has a two-fold value: the relationship with the territory that is home to us and with which we have strong bonds, but also an important ‘business card’ for passengers who come from all over the world and who will have the chance to appreciate our brand up close. A link with the local but with a global vision, therefore right in step with Lamborghini philosophy.”
